issue.description: Components CT737125 and CR388028 overlap. This is based on several cDNAs which show genes in common, and duplicate genes between the components.
issue.resolution_text: Components CT737125 and CR388028 overlapped. This was based on several cDNAs which showed genes in common. CR388028 was therefore removed from the tilepath.

issue.summary: There is a gap between accessions CR376823.6 and CU463105.4 flanked by the repeat type Dr000310-Dr000317-drr861

issue.description: There is a gap between accessions CR376823.6 and CU463105.4 flanked by the repeat type Dr000310-Dr000317-drr861
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.description: CR628410 and FP236851 should be next to each other. One of these components will need to be complimented.
issue.resolution_text: Checked the pcsk5b locus in Ensembl and it looks like this gene is only present on CR628410.11. None of the loci I have checked (Em) refute this. Performed additional alignment checks in gap 4 and TPF solo and found no evidence to support the claim that the clones sit next to each other.

issue.description: Components CU914488 and FP236231 overlap. This is confirmed by locus nr6a1a. This is presently in two parts. After one of the components is complimented (likely CU914488) these two parts can be joined.
issue.resolution_text: There is no sequence evidence for an alignment between these clones. The self-comp in PGP shows no alignment and checking the sequence for alignments yields nothing either, therefore this ticket will be closed.
